intro: Sida galheirensis f. angustodontia, commonly known as the narrow-toothed sida, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
